alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 3:10PM CDT until May 29 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Cambridge affecting Furnas County. For the REPUBLICAN RIVER...including Cambridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Cambridge, with this Warning also valid downstream to the Furnas/Harlan County line. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs as the right bank overflows. Water will start flowing through sloughs south of the main channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.8 feet, slightly below the official flood stage of 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river appears to be in the process of cresting, and will likely hover near to just below 9.0 feet through Sunday afternoon and evening before starting to slowly fall. The stage is expected to fall to around 8.5 feet by sunrise Monday, and 7.5 feet by early Monday evening. Please note that there is the possibility of additional rain within the Republican River basin through tonight that if heavy enough could cause deviations from the current forecast. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 04/25/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
